newsitem.title: LATVIA: CENTRAL DEPOSITORY TO REGISTER CLOSED ISSUE.
newsitem.headline: CENTRAL DEPOSITORY TO REGISTER CLOSED ISSUE.

text.p: The central depository on Thursday said it will register closed issues worth at least one million lats in the same procedure as for public securities.

"The registration of closed issues is only suitable when the volume is at least one million lats and investors are mainly financial market professionals, like banks and insurance companies," Martinsh Rikshis, president of the depository, told a news conference.
The depository charges a one-off registration payment of a maximum 900 lats for the service with no annual payment related to the size of the issue.
The depository will also take care of money transactions related to these issues, such as interest payments.
"The latest closed issue we registered was Finnish Merita Bank's lat bond issue, planned to reach 15 million lats," Rikshis said.
